metadata.title: RFTPU: Resonance Fourier Transform Processor - Technical Specification V2.0
metadata.description:
RFTPU Technical Specification Document Version 2.0

The Resonance Fourier Transform Processor (RFTPU) is a specialized hardware accelerator implementing the Φ-RFT (Phi-Resonance Fourier Transform) algorithm family. This release includes:

  • Complete RTL Implementation: 12 proven unitary RFT kernel variants in FPGA (fpga_top.sv) and ASIC blueprint (rftpu_architecture.tlv)
  • Scientific Method Documentation: Honest assessment including critical discovery that Φ-phase FFT has NO sparsity advantage over FFT
  • Full Traceability: LaTeX proofs → Python implementation → Hardware RTL
  • Performance Projections: Architectural estimates (NOT silicon-validated) of ~2.39 TOPS, ~291 GOPS/W
  • HD 4K Figures: Publication-quality visualizations with proper disclaimers

⚠️ Important Disclaimers

Performance figures are architectural projections, derived from analytic models using FO4 delay assumptions and activity factor estimates. These are NOT post-layout, back-annotated, or silicon-validated results. No chip has been fabricated. See Appendix A for derivation methodology.

Key Technical Achievements

  • 12 RFT kernel variants, all proven unitary (error < 10⁻¹³)
  • 8×8 tile architecture with 64 processing elements
  • Q1.15 fixed-point representation for hardware efficiency
  • WebFPGA validated at 27.62 MHz (2.3× margin over 12 MHz target) — this IS measured
  • H3 Hierarchical Cascade with zero coherence (η=0)

Scientific Corrections

This version includes important corrections to earlier claims:

  • Sparsity: The closed-form Φ-RFT (Ψ = D_φ C_σ F) has |Ψx|_k = |Fx|_k, providing NO sparsity advantage. The canonical RFT via eigenbasis DOES provide domain-specific sparsity.
  • Non-equivalence: Proven for N ≤ 32; general N remains open.

Reproducibility

python scripts/run_proofs.py --full --report results/validation.json
